svcsubproc.title: Transmission Fluid Cooler

note.para: Cleaning and backflushing the transmission fluid cooling system along with following all the normal cleaning and inspection procedures during disassembly and reassembly will keep contamination from entering the transmission, causing a repeat repair.

svcsubproc.para: When internal wear or damage has occurred in the transmission, metal particles or clutch plate material may have been carried into the torque converter and transmission fluid cooler. These contaminants are a major cause of recurring transmission troubles and must be removed from the system before the transmission is put back into use.

note.para: The transmission linkage/cable adjustment, fluid level and line pressure must be within specification before carrying out this test. Refer to Fluid Level Check under Verification of Condition in this section. Refer to Line Pressure Test under Special Testing Procedures in this section. For shift linkage/cable adjustment procedures, refer to Automatic Transaxle/Transmission External Controls.

step1.para: Install EZ-Tech and monitor the transmission fluid temperature (TFT) sensor.
Remove the fluid level indicator from the fluid filler tube.
Place a funnel in the fluid filler tube.
With the vehicle in NEUTRAL, position it on a hoist. For additional information, refer to Jacking and Lifting in S10019.
Disconnect the cooler return tube (rear fitting) from the transmission case.
Connect one end of a hose to the cooler return tube and route the other end of the hose up to a point where it can be inserted into the funnel at the fluid filler tube.
Insert the end of a hose into the funnel.
Start the engine and run at idle with the transmission in the NEUTRAL range.

Once a steady flow of fluid (without air bubbles) is observed, remove the hose from the funnel and place the hose in a measuring container for 15 seconds. After 15 seconds, place the hose back into the funnel and turn the engine off. Measure the amount of fluid in the container.

svcsubproc.para: There is a temperature valve in the pump. Cooler flow rates will vary according to automatic transmission fluid temperature. The use of a diagnostic tool will determine the actual fluid temperature. If adequate flow is observed into the container, the test is now complete.

step1.para: If adequate flow is not observed, turn off the engine. Disconnect the hose from the cooler return line (transmission inlet).
Disconnect the fluid cooler tube from the front case fitting and connect the hose to the case fitting (converter out) and repeat Steps 7, 8 and 9.

If adequate flow is not observed from the transmission, look for a plugged or crushed cooler tube, plugged remote filter manifold orifice, and/or fluid cooler. Refer to Transaxle/Transmission Cooling for diagnosis of the transmission fluid cooler.
If adequate flow is still not observed, repair or installation of a new pump and/or torque converter may be required.

svcsubproc.para: For the installation of new transmission fluid cooler tubes, refer to Transaxle/Transmission Cooling.
